reporter_caption.center: IN RE A MEMBER OF STATE BAR, FRANKLIN, SB-07-0181-D (Ariz. 1-8-2008)

caption.center: IN THE MATTER OF A MEMBER OF THE STATE BAR OF ARIZONA, JOHN T. FRANKLIN,

opinion.opinion_text:
A Motion for Interim Suspension was filed by the State Bar. RespondentJohn T Franklin filed a response. After considering the motion and response, the Court finds that the motion for interim suspension should be granted. Accordingly,
IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Rule 61(c), Rules of the Supreme Court, that John T Franklin is hereby suspended from the practice of law, effective this date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the suspension shall continue in effect until final disposition of all pending proceedings against John TFranklin, unless earlier vacated or modified.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that John T Franklin, from this date, shall not accept for representation any new cases, nor shall he agree to represent any existing client after the effective date of this Order.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that John T Franklin is precluded from distributing funds from any trust account to anyone except with the written approval of bar counsel or of this court.Page 2
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that pursuant to Rule 72(a), Rules of the Supreme Court of Arizona, John T Franklin shall notify all his clients within ten (10) days from the date hereof of his inability to continue to represent them and that they should promptly retain new counsel, and shall promptly inform this Court of his compliance with this Order as provided by Rule 72(e), Rules of the Supreme Court of Arizona.
DATED this ___ day of January, 2008.
